{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3123399,"name":"Rufus Mainwaring","username":"Rufus_t_Doofus","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rufus_t_doofus/{size}/179852_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-11T18:35:38.141Z","cooked":"

We are planning to run the KOP chasis this year with modified width and wanted to use our NEOs most efficiently. Our lead mentor did some research (as well as I) on using NEOs and found some people having overheating issues when mounted against pc (non-metal). We’re aware that this is because the front plate is where the majority of the heat dissipation occurs on NEOs. Basically, we wanted to know where there might be issues with mounting NEOs, and if it is a good idea to use them on KOP.

Rufus-847 Lead

There will be no issues with using the NEO mounted to the kitbot chassis.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2023-01-11T18:39:39.731Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":304,"readers_count":303,"score":300.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":422481,"topic_slug":"neos-with-kitbot","display_username":"REV Robotics Co-founder & CEO","primary_group_name":"REV","flair_name":"REV","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/d/b/db93216ec14c273ae2ca04aa396186c0461d0620.png","flair_bg_color":"F05A28","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":55,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"REV Robotics","title_is_group":false,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":19}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":511,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/neos-with-kitbot/422481/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":14},{"id":"call_me_hand","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":19,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3123416,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-11T18:50:19.010Z","cooked":"

Ran the 2022 Electric City Regional on four NEOs in Toughbox Mini gearboxes, including seven matches of hellish defense. Zero gearbox issues.

Now, were the motors running cooler when we switched to an aluminum plate gearbox and we added two more for Championship? Sure. You’d expect them to. But I don’t have any concerns about NEOs and TB Minis.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2023-01-11T18:51:08.798Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":275,"readers_count":274,"score":85.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":422481,"topic_slug":"neos-with-kitbot","display_username":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":3095,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"says you should come to SCRIW in October"},"post_url":"/t/neos-with-kitbot/422481/3","custom_user_title":"says you should come to SCRIW in October","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3123419,"name":"ASmith1675","username":"ASmith1675","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asmith1675/{size}/3328_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-11T18:52:51.648Z","cooked":"

Also ran NEO with kitbot last year. We changed out the gearing to be around 17ft/s free speed. No issues through 2 regionals and an offseason. Little to no maintenance.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2023-01-11T18:53:00.488Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":255,"readers_count":254,"score":66.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":422481,"topic_slug":"neos-with-kitbot","display_username":"ASmith1675","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9669,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I don't know what that building is, but I want to build robots there."},"post_url":"/t/neos-with-kitbot/422481/4","custom_user_title":"I don't know what that building is, but I want to build robots there.","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3123420,"name":"Jon Stratis","username":"Jon_Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-11T18:53:34.364Z","cooked":"

We’ve smoked Neo’s in the past, but it was always due to stalling at high power levels, not due to mounting. We’ve mounted them to plenty of plastic surfaces in both high speed and high torque situations without issue.

Our 2019 robot is still running with these same Neo’s today:

image1920×1440 255 KB

NEOs in a kitbot cooks, 1257 did it a few years back and it zoomed. Only suggestion is to double-check the current limits if you do run into overheating issues. The Spark Max API allows you to get motor temperature too.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2023-01-11T19:02:52.333Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":197,"readers_count":196,"score":84.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":422481,"topic_slug":"neos-with-kitbot","display_username":"Kim","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":28161,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"she/her | old curmudgeon"},"post_url":"/t/neos-with-kitbot/422481/6","custom_user_title":"she/her | old curmudgeon","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3123431,"name":"Alex Van Aacken","username":"Pompano","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pompano/{size}/174351_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-11T19:03:24.238Z","cooked":"

Ran robots with NEOs in the Kitbot gearboxes for 2 years now… it will work perfectly fine. (I say ran cuz 2023 = swerve)

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2023-01-11T19:03:39.098Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":194,"readers_count":193,"score":53.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":422481,"topic_slug":"neos-with-kitbot","display_username":"Alex Van Aacken","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50713,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6925 Alum"},"post_url":"/t/neos-with-kitbot/422481/7","custom_user_title":"6925 Alum","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3123492,"name":"Brendan Simons, 5406","username":"nuclearnerd","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuclearnerd/{size}/7324_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-11T19:50:19.113Z","cooked":"

You may want to reduce the default current limit from 80A to 70A or 60A. That would allow you to stall your motors for most of a match and not overheat according to Rev’s test data. Depending on the weight and gearing of your robot, a lower current limit could prevent brownouts when accelerating on a low-charge battery too.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2023-01-11T19:50:19.113Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":172,"readers_count":171,"score":69.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":422481,"topic_slug":"neos-with-kitbot","display_username":"Brendan Simons, 5406","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.revrobotics.com/neo-brushless-motor-locked-rotor-testing/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"NEO Brushless Motor - Locked-rotor Testing","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22221,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/neos-with-kitbot/422481/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3123494,"name":"what?","username":"sethP","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/91b2a8/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-11T19:52:49.843Z","cooked":"

I would also like to point out that you should set your current limits in code as we have found values set on the spark max to be somewhat unreliable

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2023-01-11T19:52:49.843Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":161,"readers_count":160,"score":62.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":422481,"topic_slug":"neos-with-kitbot","display_username":"what?","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":22221,"username":"nuclearnerd","name":"Brendan Simons, 5406","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuclearnerd/{size}/7324_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50198,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/neos-with-kitbot/422481/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3123504,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-11T19:57:26.462Z","cooked":"

The only time I’ve ever seen a team overheat drive motors on a kitbot is when they used larger-than-stock drive wheels (thus under-gearing the drive system).

If you’re not doing anything crazy to your kitbot you should be fine.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2023-01-12T13:52:54.727Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":154,"readers_count":153,"score":60.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":422481,"topic_slug":"neos-with-kitbot","display_username":"Chris Bale","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6560,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/neos-with-kitbot/422481/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3123960,"name":"Andrew Milakovich","username":"Donut","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/donut/{size}/1525_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-12T04:13:04.657Z","cooked":"

Your NEOs will be fine. Ran ours on a kitbot last year for our lone Regional and then 5 off season events.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2023-01-12T04:13:14.846Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":124,"readers_count":123,"score":39.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":422481,"topic_slug":"neos-with-kitbot","display_username":"Andrew Milakovich","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4773,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC Team 2662 Lead Mentor & 498 Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/neos-with-kitbot/422481/11","custom_user_title":"FRC Team 2662 Lead Mentor & 498 Alumni","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3123963,"name":"Mr.R^2","username":"Mr.R_2","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mr.r_2/{size}/89723_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-12T04:19:01.766Z","cooked":"

While there is definitely no issue using Neos (we have done so multiple years), this game has the potential to teach a hard lesson about underbelly cable management. Neos do not work if the cables come unplugged (do any motors?), But they have more cables than any other motor and they can be mounted in a way where the cables are more likely to catch on things you drive over.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2023-01-12T04:19:01.766Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":115,"readers_count":114,"score":68.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":422481,"topic_slug":"neos-with-kitbot","display_username":"Mr.R^2","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":30291,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/neos-with-kitbot/422481/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3124168,"name":"","username":"8024Coach","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/8024coach/{size}/181109_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-12T14:05:13.479Z","cooked":"

We ran a very light robot last year and used just 1 NEO in each mini toughbox on our chassis. No overheating issues and we had to turn down the power to prevent our robot from tipping and doing wheelies(Tall, light robot). Robot ran 2 regionals, into the finals, and several months of community outreach during the off season.

I would say overheating would come from lack of lubrication in the drivetrain making the motors work harder, or not adjusting the motors power properly for the use intended. We’ve also noticed NEOs can be more susceptible to interference if your route your wiring incorrectly which can let out that magic smoke ,if not fixed.
